post: With specialized photography that filtered for scorch, the real scorches from the 1532 fire show while the image disappears. The scorch was ruled out by STURP in 1978. A scorch would penetrate the cloth more than the few microns of the Shroud image. A scorch could not touch selected fibers 1/500th of an inch while not touching adjacent fibers. Also, the scorch does not account for the many other properties…3 Dimensionality, image not beneath blood, But if it is a scorch, than just make one. Surely with 21st century technology we should have a shroud duplicate from medieval technology..
